translation.en: ♪ Ride on the Magic School Bus ♪
I knew I should have stayed home todayyyyyy!
Booster shutdown and separation in three...
translation.ko: 로켓 추진을 끝내고 단 분리에 들어갑니다

translation.en: We'll have you in micro-gravity in a micro-second, Ralphie.
translation.ko: 이제 곧 극미 중력 상태가 될 거야, 랄피

translation.en: Which has got to stand for, "It's so spectacular!"
I just have to line up the things...
Oops. A little to the left. A little to the... Ohh! Ohh!
translation.ko: 위치만 잘 맞추면 돼 조금만 왼쪽으로...

translation.en: [Ms. Frizzle] OK, OK, nope. Steady as she goes.
translation.ko: - 프리즐 선생님 - 오, 이런 찬찬히 맞추면 돼 그렇지, 잠깐

translation.en: [Arnold] And I'm totally comfortable with our speed now.
translation.ko: 지금 이 정도 빠르기는 돼야 마음이 놓이네요

translation.en: Well, Ralphie, because you're in micro-gravity,
translation.ko: 랄피, 그건 여기가 극미 중력이기 때문이란다

translation.en: you're not so much flying as you are falling. Continuously.
You're floating because you're in continuous freefall around the Earth.
translation.ko: 지구 주변을 계속 자유 낙하하며 떠 있는 거야

translation.en: OK, but... it's still a superpower.
[straining] Wait for me! Why can't I move?
Just push off of something and you'll go in the opposite direction.
translation.ko: 무언가를 잡고 밀면 반대 방향으로 갈 거야

translation.en: Or just grab onto the Carlos Express.
translation.ko: 아니면 카를로스 특급 열차를 타도 돼

translation.en: As soon as I figure out how to release all the extra seat belts I added.
translation.ko: 일부러 안전띠를 더 맸는데 이거만 풀면 바로 갈게

translation.en: -[kid scoffs] -What? We're 400 kilometers above the Earth.
Hey, guys! Good to see all of you. How are ya?

translation.ko: 잠깐, 예전에 와 보신 적 있어요?

translation.en: I did a four-month tour of duty up here right after my last stint with the circus.
Who knew the flying trapeze would prepare me for space?
translation.ko: 공중그네 기술을 우주에서 써먹을 줄은 몰랐지

translation.en: And these must be the rookie astronauts we've heard so much about.
translation.ko: 우리에게 말한 신입 우주 비행사가 이 아이들이군요

translation.en: No, these are a different set of children.
These are the very first kids to board the International Space Station.
Commander Hadfield told us you guys did a great job at NASA space training.
translation.ko: 해드필드 사령관님 말씀으로는 나사의 훈련 과정을 멋지게 소화했다더군요

translation.en: We all trained super hard for this mission.
We are so ready for anything!
But maybe not quite ready to live in micro-g.
translation.ko: 하지만 극미 중력에는 대비가 덜 됐나 보네요

translation.en: Just take it slowly. You'll get the hang of it.
translation.ko: 천천히 적응해요 금방 요령이 생길 테니까

translation.en: Your class has the station until the next crew arrives tomorrow morning.
translation.ko: 다음 대원들이 올 내일 아침까지 정거장을 마음껏 써도 돼요

translation.en: [laughs] Yeah. You can be even lazier than usual.
[laughs] I know, right? I don't even have to hold up my head.
translation.ko: 정말 그래 머리도 들 필요가 없다니까?

translation.en: We don't wanna be moving around in our flight suits.
translation.ko: 우주정거장인데 비행복을 입고 있을 순 없지

translation.en: [gasps] Oh! I almost forgot. Bus drone incoming!
What have you got there, Jyoti?
Whatever Itty-B sees, we see on my FrizzPad.
translation.ko: 꼬맹이 비가 보는 장면을 프리즈패드로 볼 수 있어

translation.en: Is that the Bus remote, Ms. Frizzle?
As you know, it's also the Porta-Shrinker...
I just had this little feature installed. It's called the Shriek-a-Maker.
translation.ko: 이 기능도 얼마 전에 추가했단다 이른바 '비명 제조기'야

translation.en: I think maybe one Shriek-a-Maker is enough.
translation.ko: 비명은 한쪽만 제조해도 될 것 같은데요

translation.en: [Ms. Frizzle] If you say so. Keep this in a safe place, then.
Before we get to work, I have something very special to show you.
translation.ko: 일을 시작하기 전에 아주 특별한 걸 하나 보여줄게

translation.en: This is my most favorite, favorite, favorite place in the Space Station.
[Wanda] It makes me feel very small.

translation.ko: 저 자신이 정말 작게 느껴지면서도 모두와 이어진 느낌이에요

translation.en: OK, astronauts, you all have your assigned positions.
translation.ko: 좋아, 우주 비행사 여러분 각자 맡은 역할이 있죠?
국제 우주 정거장 여러분 좋은 아침입니다!

translation.en: Actually, days are only 90 minutes long on the station.
The ISS orbits Earth 16 times every 24 hours.
Which means we'll see the sun rise and set 16 times today.
translation.ko: 즉, 우리는 해가 뜨고 지는 걸 하루에 16번씩 볼 수 있지
그리고 빼놓을 수 없는 한 자리...

translation.en: The janitor. I'm psyched! 'Cause I get to do stuff like this.
translation.ko: 관리인이야! 난 정말 좋아 이런 것도 할 수 있거든

translation.en: Since there aren't any washing machines on the ISS,
dirty laundry goes into a capsule that we drop into Earth's atmosphere,
translation.ko: 더러운 빨래를 캡슐에 모아서 지구 대기층으로 보내면

translation.en: where it burns it up as it falls.
Is that... a monogrammed hand towel?
Yup. Never leave Earth without one.
translation.ko: 응 이거 없이 지구를 떠날 순 없지

translation.en: Now to make this place smell lemon pine springtime mountain air fresh.
translation.ko: 이제 정거장 안을 상쾌한 봄날 산속 레몬 향 공기로

translation.en: You know what, fun fact: they don't allow aerosol cans in space because...
translation.ko: 하지만 에어로졸 분무기는 우주에서 쓸 수 없단다, 왜냐면...

translation.en: In the station's micro-g, we can only really move around
translation.ko: 우주정거장은 극미 중력이기 때문에 우리가 움직이려면 물건을 잡고 밀거나

translation.en: when we push ourselves off a surface
or when a force pushes against us,
like compressed air shooting out of an aerosol can.
translation.ko: 에어로졸 분무기는 공기를 뿜으면서 그런 힘을 내지

translation.en: For every action, there's an equal and opposite reaction.
translation.ko: 모든 작용에는 반작용이 똑같이 일어나게 돼 있어

translation.en: -Can I do it again? -We're in space, Ralphie.
translation.ko: 또 해봐도 되나요? 여긴 우주야, 랄피 훈련이 아니라고

translation.en: This isn't a drill. You need to be serious.
translation.ko: 여긴 우주야, 랄피 훈련이 아니라고 진지하게 임해야지

translation.en: When am I ever not serious?
Um, all those times during space training?
translation.ko: 우주 훈련 받을 때도 계속 그랬잖아

translation.en: I'm having a lot of fun at Space Training...
Aaah! Direct hit, but no effect.
The alien shields are too strong.
Our photon cannons are useless against a ship of this size.
translation.ko: 우리의 광자 대포로는 이만한 함대와 맞설 수 없습니다!

translation.en: OK, but now that we're actually in space, I will be super serious. Trust me.
translation.ko: 그래, 알았어 하지만 이제 진짜 우주에 왔으니 진짜 진지하게 할게, 믿어 줘

translation.en: Good. And the first step in being serious is communication.
translation.ko: 좋아, 진지하게 하려면 우선 의사소통이 가장 중요해

translation.en: It's important to let everyone know what you're doing at all times.
translation.ko: 네가 뭘 하고 있는지 항상 모두에게 꼭 알려줘
알았어 난 지금 겨드랑이를 긁고 있어

translation.en: I'm scratching my armpit now because it's super itchy.
translation.ko: 알았어 난 지금 겨드랑이를 긁고 있어 너무 가렵거든

translation.en: So there's no such thing as over-communicating in space?
translation.ko: 우주에서는 사소한 일도 전부 공유하는 게 좋은 거지?

translation.en: Even the labels here are written in both English and Russian
translation.ko: 심지어 라벨도 영어와 러시아어 둘 다 적혀 있어

translation.en: for the crews that speak those languages.
English-speaking astronauts learn a little Russian
translation.ko: 영어를 쓰는 대원들은 러시아어를 조금씩 배우고

translation.en: and Russian cosmonauts learn a little English.
translation.ko: 러시아인 우주 비행사들도 영어를 조금 배워

translation.en: That's right, and they end up speaking a mixture of the two called "Runglish."
translation.ko: 맞아, 그러다 나중엔 두 언어를 합친 '영시아어'를 하지

translation.en: All right, class, to your stations.
[Like Darth Vader] Wanda, this is your destiny...
It's the US laboratory where many science experiments
translation.ko: 미국의 실험실인데 언제나 여러 가지 과학 실험이 이루어지는 곳이지

translation.en: are being run at any given time.
translation.ko: 언제나 여러 가지 과학 실험이 이루어지는 곳이지

translation.en: Sometimes the best way to understand how things work
is to look at them in a brand-new way.
Have a look at this, Science Officer Wanda. It's a tardigrade.
translation.ko: 과학 책임자 완다, 이것 좀 보게 완보류 동물이야

translation.en: [Wanda] Ooh. I've read about tardigrades, but I've never seen one for real.
translation.ko: 완보류에 관한 책은 읽어봤지만 실제로 본 건 처음이에요

translation.en: They're the only known animals that can survive
in the irradiated vacuum of space, right?
translation.ko: 우주의 진공 상태에서도 살 수 있잖아요

translation.en: Which is why scientists are interested in studying them in this environment.
translation.ko: 그래서 과학자들이 관심을 두고 이런 환경에서 연구 중이란다

translation.en: It's two hairs past "I need to adjust the solar panels
translation.ko: 전력이 끊기지 않게 태양광 패널을 조정해야

translation.en: or we'll lose power and freeze in space" o'clock.
translation.ko: 우주 진공에서 버틸 텐데 조금 늦었구나

translation.en: What are you looking at, Wanda?
[Ralphie] Blecch. It looks like something I need to clean up.
It's a tardigrade, and it's cute.
Just look at those chubby legs.
Who's a cute little water animal?
I'm going to call you... Pinky.
Hey, who wants in on this genuine Space Ice Cream I brought?
translation.ko: 저기 별나라 아이스크림 사 왔는데 먹을 사람?

translation.en: Blasting dirty laundry into space is hungry work.
translation.ko: 더러운 빨래를 우주에 버렸더니 정말 배고파졌어

translation.en: You do know Space Ice Cream
translation.ko: 별나라 아이스크림은 우주에서 먹으면 안 되는 거

translation.en: isn't actually supposed to be eaten in space, right?
translation.ko: 별나라 아이스크림은 우주에서 먹으면 안 되는 거 너도 알지?

translation.en: Why would they call it "Space Ice Cream" if you can't eat it in space?
translation.ko: 이름이 별나라 아이스크림인데 우주에서 왜 못 먹어?

translation.en: Good, 'cause if those crumbs get into the ISS's delicate electronics,
translation.ko: - 내가 이따가 치울게 - 다행이네 우주정거장의 민감한 전자 기기에 이런 부스러기가 들어가면

translation.en: Is this you taking things seriously?
[mouth full] But this stuff is seriously good.
[groans] I'll find the portable vacuum cleaner. [Wanda] I'll help you look.
No, I'm the Chief Maintenance Officer. I'll clean up this mess.
translation.ko: 아니, 최고 관리 책임자는 나야 이건 내가 치울게

translation.en: Hey, Arn, that's the Porta-Shrinker, isn't it?
If I biggify these crumbs, they'll be easier to catch.
translation.ko: 부스러기 크기를 키우면 치우기 더 수월할 거야

translation.en: I can see the logic. But be safe, OK?
translation.ko: 무슨 말인지는 알겠는데 안전하게 해야 해, 알았지?

translation.en: Cool! Now the crumbs are the size of baseballs.

translation.ko: - 휘두릅니다! - 야! 스트라이크! 다음 공을 던집니다

translation.en: It's a high fly ball! And Carlos catches it.
Over to you, Chief Maintenance Officer.
C'mon, everyone. Time to get back to work.
translation.ko: 자, 얘들아 이제 일하러 가자 우린 우주정거장을 운영해야 해

translation.en: We have a space station to run.
translation.ko: 이제 일하러 가자 우린 우주정거장을 운영해야 해

translation.en: Another fine job by the Chief Maintenance Officer.
translation.ko: 최고 관리 책임자가 또 한 번 멋지게 해냈군요

translation.en: Phew. That really made me work up a sweat. Whoo!
This towel is really filling up.
translation.ko: 이 수건은 정말 흡수가 잘 되네

translation.en: What in the name of all that's black hole-y is that?
translation.ko: 이 시커먼 구멍은 대체 정체가 뭐야?

translation.en: You know, when I first came up here,
I tried to wash my hair using regular shampoo,
but when you try to rinse it out, the water goes everywhere.
translation.ko: 그런데 헹구려고 하니까 물이 사방으로 튀었지 뭐니

translation.en: So now I use this special rinseless shampoo.
translation.ko: 그래서 이제는 헹굴 필요 없는 특수 샴푸를 쓰지

translation.en: ♪ Just rub it in your hair And leave it there ♪
translation.ko: 그냥 머리에 문지르고 그대로 내버려 두면 돼

translation.en: It's "the CO2 levels need to be adjusted or we'll be in serious trouble" o'clock.
translation.ko: 이산화 탄소 수치를 조절하지 않으면 심각한 상황이 될 시간이구나

translation.en: [laughs] Never a dull moment on the ISS.
I love how you don't need any chairs in space.
translation.ko: 우주에서는 의자가 필요 없으니 정말 좋아

translation.en: Who wants some macaroni and cheese, hot from the oven?
translation.ko: 오븐에서 갓 구운 마카로니 앤 치즈 먹을 사람?

translation.en: Ralphie, what did I say about communication?
OK, that's better communication. But as Commander, it's my job to...
translation.ko: 좋아, 그건 좀 말이 되네 하지만 나는 사령관으로서...
임무 관제소에 연락해 나머지 사람들은... 숨어!

translation.en: -Great idea, Safety Officer. -Just doing my job.
translation.ko: 그거야, 보안 책임자 이게 내 일인걸

translation.en: I've seen way too many scary movies to hide in a bathroom.
translation.ko: 괴물에게 쫓기다 화장실에 숨는 영화를 많이 봤어

translation.en: Hang on, I'm getting a brilliant Chief Maintenance Officer idea.
translation.ko: 잠깐, 최고 관리 책임자로서 놀라운 생각이 떠올랐어

translation.en: Both toilets on the ISS work with a fan suction system
translation.ko: 우주정거장의 화장실은 모두 흡입 장치가 있어서

translation.en: to suck the pee and pookadumpadoody away.
Can we talk plumbing when we're not being hunted by a monster?
translation.ko: 화장실 뚫는 얘기는 괴물이 없을 때 하면 안 돼?

translation.en: This tube is for number one and this seat is where you do number two.
translation.ko: 이 튜브를 1번으로 쓰고 이 자리를 2번으로 쓰면 돼

translation.en: I see where you're going. We could--
Suck the monster out into space--
The monster's way too big to fit down there.
Don't worry. I'm sure you're "flushed" with other ideas.
translation.ko: 하지만 걱정 안 할게 네게 다른 생각이 있을 테니까

translation.en: Now I have to go to the bathroom.
Nothing like the clean, crisp taste of water distilled from astronaut urine.
translation.ko: 우주 비행사의 소변을 정화한 물은 정말 상쾌하다니까

translation.en: -[kids scream] -Oh, come on! It's been filtered and cleaned by the water reclamation system
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 우주정거장의 재생 장치로 전부 걸러내고 정화해서

translation.en: and turned back into pure drinking water.
Ewww! I don't know what's scarier, the monster or that fact.
translation.ko: 웩! 괴물이랑 저 사실 중에 뭐가 더 무서운 걸까?

translation.en: Oh! You guys, don't be so judge-y.
Water treatment plants on Earth do sort of the same thing.

translation.ko: - 프리즐 선생님! - 우리 바로 뒤에 있어!

translation.en: [Ralphie] Why me, why me, why me?
I can't, I can't, I can't.
Living creatures need it, no matter how small or big they may be.
Told ya you should never leave Earth without it.
translation.ko: 이거 없이 지구를 떠날 순 없다니까

translation.en: You guys, I think our "monster" is Pinky.
translation.ko: 얘들아, 내 생각에는 그 괴물이 핑키 같아

translation.en: I'd know those cute, chubby legs anywhere.
translation.ko: 그렇게 귀엽고 통통한 다리는 바로 알아보지

translation.en: How did it get so big?
I turned on the cameras to record our time here.
I can rewind the footage to see what happened.
translation.ko: 영상을 되감아서 어떻게 된 일인지 보자

translation.en: Keep it together, Keesha. Don't think about the giant monster.
translation.ko: 정신 차리자, 키샤 거대한 괴물은 생각하지 말고 심호흡해

translation.en: [inhales sharply] Now send the SOS to Mission Control.
Is there an intercom system? There's something I need to communicate.
translation.ko: 혹시 내부 통신 장치가 있어? 의사소통할 일이 있거든

translation.en: The monster is actually a tardigrade.
Ooh, my brilliant class does it again.
translation.ko: 우리 멋진 반 아이들이 또 시작이네

translation.en: I... accidentally biggified it with the Porta-Shrinker.
translation.ko: 그게... 내가 축소 장치로 크게 만들었어

translation.en: So here's what I'm going to do: I'm going to find the Porta-Shrinker
translation.ko: 그래서 이렇게 하려고 해 휴대용 축소 장치를 찾아서 완보류를 다시 작게 만들 거야

translation.en: and zap the tardigrade small again.
translation.ko: 휴대용 축소 장치를 찾아서 완보류를 다시 작게 만들 거야

translation.en: Meanwhile, stay away from the giant tardigrade.
translation.ko: 그때까지 커다란 완보류를 피해서 있도록 해

translation.en: It may not be dangerous, but then again, who knows?
translation.ko: 위험하진 않을 것 같지만 혹시 모르잖아?

translation.en: "how to deal with a giant tardigrade floating around the ISS,"
translation.ko: 우주정거장에 떠다니는 커다란 완보류 동물을 어떻게 처리해야 할지 찾아봤는데

translation.en: but for some reason I'm not finding anything.
translation.ko: 어찌 된 일인지 아무것도 나오지 않아

translation.en: However we can find the tardigrade with Itty-B.
translation.ko: 하지만 꼬맹이 비를 써서 완보류를 찾을 수 있어

translation.en: We can watch through its camera.
But there's nothing to worry about, right?
translation.ko: 하지만 걱정 안 해도 되는 거지?

translation.en: Because there's like four backup systems?
these systems filter air that we can breathe and water we can drink.
translation.ko: 우리가 숨 쉬는 공기와 우리가 마시는 물은 이 장치에서 정화하는 거야

translation.en: Perplexing. It's like it's searching for something.
translation.ko: 난처해하고 있어 뭔가를 찾는 것 같아

translation.en: That may not be far from the truth. Some tardigrades are actually carnivorous.
translation.ko: 아니라고는 말 못 하겠어 완보류 중에는 육식 동물도 있거든

translation.en: Negative. Ms. Frizzle would never let that thing eat us.
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 프리즐 선생님이 두고 보지 않으실 테니까

translation.en: But if it does eat you, then you have the once-in-a-lifetime chance
to experience being eaten by a giant tardigrade.
translation.ko: 커다란 완보류에 잡아먹히는 일생일대의 경험을 하겠지!

translation.en: You know, this is even more exciting than the band of belligerent beetles
translation.ko: 전에 여기 왔을 때는 성난 딱정벌레 떼가 돌아다녔는데

translation.en: that got loose on the station when I was here.
translation.ko: 지금이 그때보다 더 신나는 것 같구나!

translation.en: I'm pretty sure we got them all.
Um... guys? The tardigrade is on the move!
It sounds like Itty-B is trying to warn us about something.
translation.ko: 꼬맹이 비가 우리에게 뭔가 경고하는 것 같아

translation.en: Oh, you guys. Where's your sense of adventure?
[panting] At least we're getting... a workout running from this thing.
translation.ko: 이렇게 도망 다니면 그래도 운동은 좀 되겠네

translation.en: It's especially important to exercise on the ISS.
According to my research, with less gravity to work against,
translation.ko: 제 조사에 따르면 우주 공간 안에서는 우리에게 작용하는 중력이 약해서

translation.en: our muscles lose strength and our bones lose some density in space.
translation.ko: 우주 공간 안에서는 우리에게 작용하는 중력이 약해서 근육이 힘을 잃고 골밀도도 낮아진대요

translation.en: We get weaker the longer we're in space? Why does anyone come here?
translation.ko: 우주에서는 몸이 약해진다고? 그렇다면 여긴 왜 오는 거야?

translation.en: Would anyone like a towel to suck up their sweat?
Gotta towel your own sweat off in micro-g.
translation.ko: 극미 중력에서는 수건으로 땀을 닦아줘야 해

translation.en: So how do we get rid of this thing?
-Lasso it? -Lure it somewhere with space stew?
translation.ko: - 저건 어떻게 없애지? - 올가미로? 우주 식량으로 유인할까?

translation.en: Build a robotic power suit to wear in an epic showdown?
translation.ko: 대단원에 걸맞은 커다란 로봇 슈트를 만들까?

translation.en: All great ideas, but just so you know, none of them worked on the beetles.
translation.ko: 전부 좋은 생각이지만 전부 딱정벌레에는 소용없었단다

translation.en: There you are. I have a great idea!
translation.ko: 여기 있었네 나에게 좋은 생각이 있어

translation.en: Maybe we don't have to get rid of the creature.
translation.ko: 그 괴물은 없애지 않아도 괜찮을지 몰라

translation.en: Still waiting for the great idea.
We could keep it. As a pet.
He has a name, remember? Pinky.
Probably not a good idea to keep it as a pet,
translation.ko: 애완동물로 키우는 건 좋은 생각이 아닌 것 같아

translation.en: and since I haven't found the Porta-Shrinker yet,
translation.ko: 게다가 아직 축소 장치를 못 찾았으니

translation.en: I know exactly what to do.
But first I need everyone on the Bus.
translation.ko: 하지만 우선 모두 버스에 타야 해
랄피는 어디 있지? 걱정하지 마라, 얘들아 금방 올 거야

translation.en: You can wake me when he gets here. Time for my scheduled shut-eye.
translation.ko: 랄피가 도착하면 날 깨우렴 지금은 예정대로 눈을 붙여야 해

translation.en: So, what's the plan? Get on the Bus and leave?
translation.ko: 그래서 계획이 뭐야? 버스를 타고 떠나자고?
- 그냥 떠날 순 없어 - 안 그래?

translation.en: As Chief Safety Officer, I say we discuss the pros and cons.
translation.ko: 보안 책임자로서 말하는데 장단점을 좀 따져보자

translation.en: This is my mess. So I'm going to clean it up.
translation.ko: 내가 잘못한 거니까 내가 치울 거야

translation.en: And I want you all to stay safe while I do it.
translation.ko: 하지만 치우는 동안 너희는 안전하게 있었으면 해

translation.en: You do know we can open the door from this side too, right?
translation.ko: 문은 이쪽에서도 열 수 있는 거 알지?

translation.en: [various kids] Oh, no! Ralphie! Get out of there!
The tardigrade is right behind you!
you overgrown science experiment gone horribly wrong because of me.
translation.ko: 내 잘못으로 엄청나게 커진 실패한 과학 실험의 결과물아!

translation.en: -[Wanda] Ralphie! -[Carlos] Come back! It's too dangerous!
[Keesha] What are you doing, Ralphie? Communication is key, remember?
translation.ko: 뭐 하는 거야, 랄피? 의사소통이 중요하다고 했잖아

translation.en: [Wanda] Yeah, and I'm going to communicate how mad I'll be if you hurt Pinky.
translation.ko: 맞아, 핑키가 잘못되면 내가 얼마나 화났는지 소통할 거야
휴대용 축소 장치 축소 장치는 어디 있지?

translation.en: Gotta find the Porta-Shrinker before Pinky finds me.
translation.ko: 핑키에게 들키기 전에 축소 장치를 찾아야 해

translation.en: This may be the worst idea I've ever had.
translation.ko: 지금까지 내가 한 생각 중에 이게 최악인 것 같다

translation.en: Wait, I'll just keep going the same direction,
translation.ko: 잠깐만 내가 멈추지 않으면 이쪽으로 계속 가게 될 거야
내가 멈추지 않으면 이쪽으로 계속 가게 될 거야

translation.en: Must get back to the hatch...
[straining] Come on, hatch. Open, open, open!
-Wha--? -Don't you dare hurt that poor tardigrade.
Giant tardigrades have feelings too, you know.
Feelings of anger, rage and fury!
Is it gonna eat him? I can't look.
How can Ms. Frizzle sleep at a time like this?
translation.ko: 선생님은 어떻게 이런 상황에서 주무시는 거지?

translation.en: According to her schedule, it's what she's supposed to be doing right now.
translation.ko: 일정에 따르면 그게 선생님이 해야 할 일이야

translation.en: The ISS orbits Earth 16 times every 24 hours
so astronauts don't have a big block of nighttime like on Earth.
translation.ko: 우주 비행사들은 지구에서처럼 긴 밤을 보낼 수가 없어

translation.en: It's very important for astronauts to get their sleep.
Yeah, I get that's super important.
Except there's a giant tardigrade loose on the station!
[kids] We're stuck in the Bus! Ms. Frizzle! Wake up! Giant tardigrade!
Looks like we'll just have to figure this one out ourselves.
translation.ko: 우리가 스스로 방법을 찾아야 할 것 같아

translation.en: No Porta-Shrinker in here either, and this is the end of the station.
translation.ko: 여기도 축소 장치가 없네 이제 여기가 끝인데

translation.en: If eating me will save everyone else...
Wanda said tardigrades are water animals,
but you've been floating around for ages without any water.
translation.ko: 그런데 넌 한참이나 물 없이 돌아다녔잖아

translation.en: You haven't been hunting us. You've been looking for water.
translation.ko: 우리를 쫓아왔던 게 아니라 물을 찾아다녔던 거구나

translation.en: The water reclamation pipes are behind the life-support systems.
translation.ko: 물 정화 배관은 생명 유지 장치 뒤에 있고

translation.en: The water pouches... even the sweat on our faces.
It was all irresistible to you, wasn't it, big guy?
translation.ko: 물이 너무 먹고 싶었던 거지 내 말이 맞니?

translation.en: I'll take that as a yes.
You're making me all thirsty now.
translation.ko: 널 보니 이제 나도 목이 말라

translation.en: A big guy like you needs more than this.
translation.ko: 너처럼 덩치가 크면 더 많이 필요하겠지

translation.en: Good thing water just drifts in globules in micro-g.
Let's shove some of these together and...
You know, you're not as gross as I thought you were.
translation.ko: 인제 보니 넌 생각보다 역겹지 않구나

translation.en: Why in the world did you swallow the Porta-Shrinker?
translation.ko: 대체 축소 장치는 왜 삼킨 거야?

translation.en: Yeccch! I don't have the handbook memorized,
translation.ko: 내가 편람을 다 외운 건 아니지만

translation.en: but I think this is well beyond normal Chief Maintenance Officer duties.
translation.ko: 보통 최고 관리 책임자가 이런 뒤처리까지 하진 않을 텐데

translation.en: Now, should I tell everyone what just happened
translation.ko: 이제 무슨 일이 있었는지 애들한테 말해주자

translation.en: or clean up this mess first and then go tell them?
We get to launch more laundry.
I'm coming for you, sweet Pinky!
Good thing tardigrades can survive in the vacuum of space.
translation.ko: 완보류는 우주 진공에서도 살 수 있어서 다행이야

translation.en: You weren't cleared for a space walk. Get back here.
translation.ko: 우주 유영은 허가를 안 받았잖아, 돌아와

translation.en: I mean I found the Porta-Shrinker. Pinky's small again.
translation.ko: 축소 장치를 찾았다고! 핑키는 다시 작아졌어

translation.en: Pinky's OK? Then I guess everything's tied up.
translation.ko: 핑키는 괜찮아? 그럼 모든 매듭이 풀렸구나

translation.en: -You OK? -What's going on with the tardigrade?
translation.ko: - 랄피! - 괜찮아? - 왜 그래? - 축소 장치는?

translation.en: No time to explain! Wanda's outside the station.
translation.ko: 설명할 시간이 없어! 완다가 우주정거장 밖에 있다고!

translation.en: She's not tethered. She's floating away!
If only we had something long enough to reach her.
translation.ko: 완다에게 닿을 만큼 긴 물건이 필요해

translation.en: The giant robotic arm attached to the outside of the station: Canadarm2.
translation.ko: 우주정거장 밖에 달린 커다란 로봇 팔을 쓰면 돼 '캐나다 암2'야

translation.en: Great thinking, Robotic Specialist. You're up.
translation.ko: 좋았어, 고맙소, 로봇 기술자 이제 가서 완다를 데려오시오!

translation.en: I can do this. I can do this!
I'm going to save Wanda, Chief Maintenance Officer style.
translation.ko: 내가 완다를 구할게 최고 관리 책임자답게

translation.en: Let me guess: you thought the tardigrade wanted to eat you,
translation.ko: 다들 완보류가 너희를 잡아먹을 거라 생각했는데

translation.en: but it was looking for water. It's a water animal, after all.
translation.ko: 사실 완보류는 수중 동물이라 물을 찾던 것뿐이고

translation.en: Ralphie found the Porta-Shrinker when the tardigrade excreted it,
translation.ko: 랄피가 완보류 배설물에서 축소 장치를 찾았을 거야

translation.en: though I have no idea how it ended up swallowing it,
and Ralphie managed to shrink it back to its regular size.
Then he cleaned up the poo and ejected the laundry capsule with its dirty clothes
translation.ko: 그런 다음 똥을 치우고 더러워진 빨래랑 같이 방출했는데

translation.en: but Wanda thought he'd ejected the tardigrade and went to save it,
translation.ko: 완다는 완보류를 버린 줄 알고 구하러 나섰는데

translation.en: neglecting to tether herself properly, so Tim used the Canadarm2 to catch her,
translation.ko: 안전띠를 제대로 매지 않아서 팀이 캐나다 암2로 잡아주려 했지만

translation.en: and he did, but Wanda's tether slipped and now she's too far away to grab.
translation.ko: 팀이 캐나다 암2로 잡아주려 했지만 끈이 미끄러졌고 너무 멀리 가 버려서

translation.en: And that's why Ralphie is trying to save Wanda.
Did I get it? Was I close?
And look at Ralphie go. Hello, Ralphie.
translation.ko: 랄피가 가는 걸 보렴 안녕, 랄피?

translation.en: I see you've learned a thing or two about moving around in micro-g.
translation.ko: 극미 중력에서 움직이는 법을 조금은 익힌 것 같구나

translation.en: Yeah, I know I can't move without pushing against something,
so I pushed off the station to head towards Wanda.
translation.ko: 우주정거장을 잡고 밀어서 완다에게 가고 있어요

translation.en: [Ms. Frizzle] Of course. It's the only way to reach Wanda.
translation.ko: 당연하지, 완다에게 가려면 그 방법밖에 없잖니

translation.en: Now to make this rescue smell lemon pine springtime mountain air fresh!
translation.ko: 상쾌한 봄날 산속 레몬 향이 나는 구조 작전을 써야겠군

translation.en: I know. I'm sorry. If I had just told everyone what I was doing first...
translation.ko: 나도 알아, 미안해 내 작전을 미리 말해줬어야 하는데

translation.en: I know, I know, "communication is key."
I'll make it up to you as soon as we're back on the station.
Thanks. Just don't do it with Space Ice Cream, OK?
translation.ko: 고마워, 하지만 별나라 아이스크림은 먹지 말자
안 먹을 거야, 남은 것도 없어

translation.en: -[Wanda] Uh-oh! -[Ralphie] Ah, well. No problem. I'll just...
translation.ko: 괜찮아, 걱정하지 마 이렇게 하면 돼

translation.en: [Tim] Oh no, they're too far out!
[Ralphie] And there's nothing left for us to push off of.
translation.ko: 잡고 밀 만한 물건이 하나도 없어

translation.en: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Ralphie, there is one thing left for us to push off of...
translation.ko: 랄피, 우리가 잡고 밀 수 있는 게 딱 하나 있어

translation.en: I'm sorry, Ralphie, but there was no other way.
translation.ko: 미안해, 랄피 하지만 이 방법밖에 없어

translation.en: What do we do? We need a plan B!
In a very short time, you've learned how to live and move in space.
translation.ko: 짧은 시간에 우주에서 생활하고 움직이는 법을 익혔구나

translation.en: [Ralphie] Repairing the damage to the Space Station.
We have some serious work to do.
translation.ko: 꼭 해야 하는 중요한 일이 있거든요

translation.en: Well said, Chief Maintenance Officer Ralphie.
translation.ko: 옳은 말씀입니다 최고 관리 책임자 랄피 님

translation.en: All of the life-support systems and their backups are online.
translation.ko: 모든 생명 유지 장치와 백업 시스템이 돌아왔습니다

translation.en: And I replenished some of our water supply. You're welcome.
translation.ko: 나는 마실 물을 정화했어 응, 천만에

translation.en: Here's a little for you too, big guy.
Another Soyuz spacecraft is here with our replacement crew.
translation.ko: 우리랑 교대할 대원들이 탄 소유스 우주선이 오는구나

translation.en: Great to see you again, kids.
So, how was your time on the ISS? Anything unusual happen?
I can't say I'm sad to be going home.
translation.ko: 집에 가는 게 아쉽다고는 말 못하겠어

translation.en: I am. I was just getting good at moving around in micro-g.
translation.ko: 난 아쉬워 극미 중력에 막 적응한 참이었는데

translation.en: I don't know about anyone else, but when I get back,
translation.ko: 다른 사람은 어떨지 몰라도 나는 집에 가면

translation.en: I'm going to sleep for 12 hours straight.
[snorts] Of course you can... share my sandwich, Pinky.
translation.ko: 당연하지 내 샌드위치 같이 먹어도 돼, 핑키

translation.en: He got so good at communicating, he's even doing it in his sleep.
Hello. Commander Hadfield here. How can I help?
When the kids arrived at the ISS,
they seemed pretty good at getting around in micro-gravity.
Well, many astronauts need a few days to get used to life in micro-g
translation.ko: 대부분의 우주 비행사들은 우주정거장에 오고 며칠이 지나야 극미 중력 생활에 적응한답니다
며칠이 지나야 극미 중력 생활에 적응한답니다

translation.en: Some even feel "space sick," which is a lot like feeling sea sick.
translation.ko: 뱃멀미와 비슷하게 우주 멀미를 느끼는 사람도 있죠

translation.en: It takes practice and some particular techniques.
translation.ko: 연습도 필요하고 몇 가지 기술도 필요해요

translation.en: The astronauts use hand holds to move ourselves around.
translation.ko: 우주 비행사들은 움직일 때 손잡이를 이용하고

translation.en: And when astronauts need to stand still,
they use foot straps to hold their feet in place.
[kid] If things go wrong on the ISS, like electrical systems being destroyed
translation.ko: 우주정거장에 사고가 나서 커다란 완보류 동물이 전기 시스템을 파괴한다면

translation.en: by a humongous tardigrade, wouldn't NASA or someone notice?
translation.ko: 커다란 완보류 동물이 전기 시스템을 파괴한다면 - 나사 같은 곳에서 알 수 있나요? - 물론이죠
- 나사 같은 곳에서 알 수 있나요? - 물론이죠

translation.en: The ISS is in constant contact with space agencies around the Earth.
translation.ko: 지구의 여러 항공 우주국과 우주정거장은 계속 통신하거든요

translation.en: Every little detail aboard the ISS,
translation.ko: 우주정거장에서 일어나는 사소한 일까지 전부 말이죠

translation.en: from the functioning of the life support systems
to what the astronauts eat, is closely monitored.
If you tried to sneak Space Ice Cream aboard...
But even if the engineers on Earth know what's going on in the ISS,
translation.ko: 하지만 지구의 엔지니어들이 여기 상황을 알고 있다고 해도

translation.en: it's still up to us to do repairs and maintenance
and keep the ISS in working order.
[kid] Ms. Frizzle was exercising to prevent muscle and bone density loss
translation.ko: 정거장에서 프리즐 선생님은 근육과 뼈가 약해지는 걸 운동으로 예방하시던데요
근육과 뼈가 약해지는 걸 운동으로 예방하시던데요

translation.en: Without gravity pulling us downwards in space,
our bodies do a lot less work supporting themselves.
translation.ko: 우리의 몸을 지지하는 데 훨씬 적은 힘을 쓴답니다

translation.en: And when you don't use your muscles, you lose them.
translation.ko: 그런 근육은 쓰지 않으면 점차 줄어들거든요

translation.en: So, astronauts need to stay on top of their workout regimens,
translation.ko: 그래서 우주 비행사들은 특별히 개조한 장치에서

translation.en: to keep their muscles and their bones in their pre-flight condition.
translation.ko: 몸의 근육과 뼈의 상태를 비행 전 상태로 유지한답니다

translation.en: I'd better start training if I'm going to be an astronaut one day.
translation.ko: 언젠가 우주 비행사가 되려면 지금부터 훈련해야겠네요

translation.en: [Arnold] Please let this be a normal field trip!
♪ Oh, cruising on down Main Street ♪
♪ Next thing that you know ♪ -♪ You're seeing... ♪ -[Ms. Frizzle] Whoo-hooo!
♪ Take a left at your intestine ♪
♪ Take your second right past Mars ♪
♪ Climb on the Magic School Bus ♪
-♪ Spank a plankton, too ♪ -[Wanda] Take that!
♪ Such a fine thing to do ♪
♪ So strap your bones right to the seat ♪
♪ Come on in and don't be shy ♪
♪ Just to make your day complete ♪
♪ You might get baked into a pie ♪
♪ Step in, step in, step inside ♪
♪ It's a wilder ride, come on! ♪
♪ Ride on the Magic School Bus! ♪
